gw.plugin.job

Interface IPolicyRenewalPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IPolicyRenewalPlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    Plugin used to determine when a PolicyPeriod should have a Renewal Job started (the actual starting is left up to PolicyRenewalStartWorkQueue.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean doesRenewalRequireConfirmation(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
      Determine whether this is a kind of policy period where renewal is confirmed by billing system.
      User getAutomatedRenewalUser(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
      Return the user used when processing this renewal in the automated workflow.
      java.util.Date getRenewalStartDate(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
      Determine the date on or after which the given PolicyPeriod should have a renewal job started.
      boolean isRenewalOffered(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
      Determine whether this is a kind of policy period where renewal is offered.
      boolean shouldStartRenewal(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
      Determine whether to start a Renewal for the supplied PolicyPeriod

    • Method Detail

      • getRenewalStartDate

        java.util.Date getRenewalStartDate(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Determine the date on or after which the given PolicyPeriod should have a renewal job started.
        Parameters:
        periodToRenew - the PolicyPeriod to be evaluated for Renewal
        Returns:
        the date that the PolicyPeriod should start a renewal on
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if something goes wrong

      • shouldStartRenewal

        boolean shouldStartRenewal(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Determine whether to start a Renewal for the supplied PolicyPeriod
        Parameters:
        periodToRenew - the period to renew.
        Returns:
        true if should start renewal.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if something goes wrong.

      • isRenewalOffered

        boolean isRenewalOffered(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
        Determine whether this is a kind of policy period where renewal is offered.
        Parameters:
        periodToRenew - the period to renew.
        Returns:
        true if a renewal offer should be sent for this policy period

      • doesRenewalRequireConfirmation

        boolean doesRenewalRequireConfirmation(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
        Determine whether this is a kind of policy period where renewal is confirmed by billing system.
        Parameters:
        periodToRenew - the period to renew.
        Returns:
        true if a renewal confirmation should be received by this policy period.

      • getAutomatedRenewalUser

        User getAutomatedRenewalUser(PolicyPeriod periodToRenew)
        Return the user used when processing this renewal in the automated workflow. This affects the permissions and authority profiles available to the renewal process, which user ends up listed as the create or update user for certain entities, and which user generates issue approvals. The User returned by this method is expected to be only used for automated renewals.
        Parameters:
        periodToRenew - the PolicyPeriod being renewed
        Returns:
        the User to process automated renewals
